intro: Monardella odoratissima subsp. euodoratissima, commonly known as the sweet peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slight pubescence. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and emit a strong, sweet scent. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
